title: 107_hr2313
content: The Act may be cited as the "Crane Tithe Tax Act of 2001" and repeals the taxation of corporations. The "Crane Tithe Tax Act of 2001" repeals various provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to corporate taxation. SEC. 3. 10 PERCENT INCOME TAX RATE FOR INDIVIDUALS. Amendment to Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to impose a 10 percent income tax rate for individuals. A 10 percent income tax rate is imposed on individuals based on the excess of earned income over the exemption amount, which is $10,000 adjusted for the cost of living. The CPI for October of the preceding calendar year is compared to the CPI for October of 2000 to determine any percentage increase. The term 'CPI' refers to the Consumer Price Index for all-urban consumers. Any increase not a multiple of $10 is rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Earned income includes wages, salaries, employee compensation, and net earnings from self-employment. Earned income includes wages, salaries, employee compensation, net earnings from self-employment, and dividends from personal service corporations. Exceptions are pension/annuity amounts and tips not at the discretion of the service-recipient. Fringe benefits included as earned income are valued at the employer's cost. SEC. 4. Amnesty for all prior tax liability before January 1, 2000, with exceptions for amounts paid before enactment and taxes related to illegal activities. SEC. 5. Repeal of special deductions, credits, and exclusions from income for individuals. SEC. 6. Repeal of estate and gift taxes. SEC. 6. REPEAL OF ESTATE AND GIFT TAXES. Subtitle B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is repealed. Effective dates apply to taxable years beginning after the enactment date. Repeal applies to estates of decedents dying after enactment. Secretary of the Treasury to submit technical changes to reflect the law changes.
